measured_by: Apathy Motivation Index – Social Motivation subscale
justification: The authors state: "Finally, we decided to measure social apathy (Ang, Lockwood, Apps, Muhammed, & Husain, 2017)," referring to the AMI questionnaire that contains a social motivation domain.

measured_by: Apathy Motivation Index – Behavioural Activation subscale
justification: The procedure notes that the online questionnaire included "apathy in the behavioural, social, and emotional domain (Ang et al., 2017)," indicating the behavioural component is taken from the AMI.
The same sentence lists the "emotional domain" of apathy measured with the Ang et al. (2017) instrument, i.e., the AMI emotional subscale.
Participants completed questions on "Big-Five personality domains (Gosling, Rentfrow, & Swann, 2003)," the reference for the Ten-Item Personality Inventory assessing traits such as extraversion.
The same Gosling et al. (2003) Big-Five measure provides an agreeableness score for each participant.
Under personality assessment the authors mention the "Big-Five personality domains," which include conscientiousness scored by the Gosling et al. brief inventory.
Emotional stability (the inverse of neuroticism) is one of the Big-Five traits captured by the Gosling et al. (2003) questionnaire used in the study.
Openness is another of the "Big-Five personality domains" measured via the brief Gosling et al. instrument completed online.

measured_by: Individual visual short-term memory orientation-recall task (80-trial assessment)
justification: "The individual short-term memory assessment aimed to test participants' capacity to recall and reproduce visual information" using 80 trials of oriented gratings, providing each participant’s memory-capacity estimate.

measured_by: Visual analogue scale rating of collaboration quality
justification: After each 25-trial block "each individual indicated on a visual analogue scale how good they thought the collaboration was," operationalising collaboration quality.

measured_by: Visual analogue scale rating of collaborator fairness
justification: Participants also rated "how fair they thought their collaborator was" on the same visual analogue scale immediately after the block.

measured_by: Visual analogue scale rating of collaborator likeability
justification: The post-block questionnaire further asked how "likeable they thought their collaborator was," captured via the visual analogue scale.
